content.title: Bermuda Triangles: GNNs Fail to Detect Simple Topological Structures
content.TL;DR: Graph neural networks can't reliably detect triangle structures in a graph
content.abstract: Most graph neural network architectures work by message-passing node vector embeddings over the adjacency matrix, and it is assumed that they capture graph topology by doing that. We design two synthetic tasks, focusing purely on topological problems -- triangle detection and clique distance -- on which graph neural networks perform surprisingly badly, failing to detect those "bermuda" triangles. We plan to make the datasets and their generation scripts publicly available.
